Personal Statment

JavaScript expert with over 7 years experience coding solutions for small to large companies, I love to craft functional and beautiful web applications and websites. I’m also an open source enthusiast and technology geek.

During my career I have developed multiple skills on frontend and backend development, agile methodologies, source version control, object oriented design and even a bit of graphical design. I develop mostly using open source tools on both Windows and GNU/Linux systems (more in the later than the former).

I’m currently looking to become a reference in front-end development related technologies in general but especially on JavaScript, to work in a company where I can contribute to develop innovative solutions using edge technologies where I can share my knowledge but also learn from experienced team members.

Productivity

I'm a firm believer in automation, as a developper, I love to make machines perform repetitive time-consuming and tedious task for me. An automated development environment is a good development environment. Whitout automation, the act of programming is tedious and error prone. Once you automate all your tedious tasks, you are a happy and productive developper. There is no reason for a human been to run code linting process, tests, building tasks and code deployment manually. Automation equials better quality products developed in less time.

I'm a natural born optimizzer, I seek for process improvements everywhere in my life, from moving coffee machine near developers to avoid unnecesary time spent walking to the kitchen and back (multiplied for number of developpers in the company times days in a year, its a huge time savings) to bettery quality tools that let me and my team deliver faster and better. Code completition, text espanding tools, macros and alike tools are part of my personal toolset for productivity.
